vectorizer

Class ModelVectorizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • vectorizer.Vectorizer
      • vectorizer.ModelVectorizer

  • public class ModelVectorizer
extends Vectorizer
    Class to generate word vectors from plain text documents or strings. It can: - use Google word vectors (GoogleNews-vectors-negative300.bin), or - train paragraph2vec models Created by halmeida on 12/7/16.

    • Method Detail

      • extractTxt2Vec

        public void extractTxt2Vec(java.util.List<DocUnit> docs)
        Generates word2vecs for plain txt files Goes over a directory of plain txt files, generates a Doc2Vec (compressed) file for either: each plain txt separately (TXT2VEC_LEVEL=doc) each label (TXT2VEC_LEVEL=label)

      • googleTxt2Vec

        public void googleTxt2Vec(DocUnit doc,
                          java.lang.String savePath,
                          boolean export)
        Generates googleWord2Vecs for strings / plain txt files. Looks for document words in the google set of vectors, populates the document with google vectors. Outputs files according to TXT2VEC_LEVEL (word2Vec for docs, or labels)
        Parameters:
        doc -
        savePath -
        export -

      • computeTxt2Vec

        public void computeTxt2Vec(DocUnit doc,
                           java.lang.String savePath,
                           boolean export)
        Generates a word2vec with regards to the TXT2VEC_LEVEL. For TXT2VEC_LEVEL=doc,vectors are generated WRT the document (one output per doc) For TXT2VEC_LEVEL=label, vectors are generated WRT the label (one output per label) Uses DL4J Paragraph2Vec algorithm (based on DBOW and Skipgram)
        Parameters:
        doc -
        export -

      • getDoc2VecModel

        private org.deeplearning4j.models.paragraphvectors.ParagraphVectors getDoc2VecModel(java.io.File file)
        Trains paragraph2vec for documents iterating over each provided document

        file -
        Returns:

        private java.lang.String getSyn1(org.nd4j.linalg.api.ndarray.INDArray array,
                                 java.lang.String label)
        Retrieves INDArray with result vector values for a document, to be used for deeplearn
        Parameters:
        array - complete paragraph2vec array
        label - document label (must start from 0)
        Returns:
